title: Practical Sexology
banerDescription: Gain practical skills and knowledge in sexology that will allow you to work in various therapeutic contexts
description:
• management staff of educational institutions
    (schools, kindergartens, nurseries, counseling centers, educational centers, others)
  • pedagogues
  • psychologists
  • speech therapists
  • therapists
  • teachers
  • parents
  • legal guardians
  • educators
  • people working with children, youth, adults, seniors
  • people working with children, youth and adults with disabilities that cause lack or limitation of communication and functioning in society
description2: The study program also includes the development of practical skills: sexological subjective examination, diagnosis, differentiation and treatment of sexual disorders, and social competencies.
description3: Graduates will be prepared to work in the field of diagnosis and therapy of sexual disorders in sexology clinics, psychiatric clinics, and hospitals.
scheduleInfo: The third semester is dedicated to internships

topics.title: Methods and tools for studying sexuality
Impact of technology on sexuality. Sexuality in the digital era, influence of media and technology
Sexual disorders - Classification, diagnosis, and therapies for sexual disorders
Therapy for compulsive sexual behaviors (cognitive-behavioral, psychodynamic, humanistic, and integrative approaches in treating sexual and relationship disorders)
Working with sexuality and gender diversity
Child as a victim of sexual violence
Adult as a victim of sexual violence
Mechanisms of child sexual abuse within and outside the family
Diagnosis and therapy for victims of sexual violence
Organic causes of sexual problems and their treatment
Sexual trends and contemporary directions in working with sexuality
Institutions operating in the field of sexual health

faculty: The program will be conducted by a qualified team of specialists in the fields of sexology, psychology, psychiatry, and therapy.
practices:
• 50% - possibility to complete internships remotely at the MAGNOLIA Psychological and Pedagogical Counseling Center
  • The remaining 50% can be completed:
    • in home institutions in the form of additional classes or performed within the teaching load,
    • in educational institutions,
    • in counseling centers,
    • other.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes will be based on: preparation of a project work in the area of Practical Sexology.
jobOpportunities: Graduates will be prepared to work in the field of diagnosis and therapy of sexual disorders in sexology clinics, psychiatric clinics, and hospitals.
invite:
